meanings.definition: The act of assenting or agreeing with something.
meanings.sent1: Her quick assentation to the proposal showed her agreement.
meanings.sent2: The assentation of the crowd indicated their approval of the new policy.
meanings.sent3: His constant assentation to everything his boss said made him seem insincere.
meanings.sent4: The politician's assentation to the public's demands won them over.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's assentation to the student's answer encouraged class participation.

meanings.definition: Flattery or excessive praise in order to gain favor.
meanings.sent1: Her assentation towards the boss was obvious as she showered him with compliments.
meanings.sent2: The salesman's assentation was so transparent that no one believed his words.
meanings.sent3: His assentation towards his friend's terrible singing made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The celebrity's assentation of her fans made them feel special and appreciated.
meanings.sent5: The politician's assentation of the voters was seen through by the public.

meanings.definition: A person who assents or agrees with something.
meanings.sent1: She was known as the assentation of the group, always in agreement with others.
meanings.sent2: The boss relied on his assentation to move forward with his plans.
meanings.sent3: The assentation in the meeting made decision-making quick and easy.
meanings.sent4: He was the assentation in the debate, supporting every argument made.
meanings.sent5: The team needed the assentation of all members to proceed with the project.
